result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:20 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Joseph Dale Alvey in court.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Joseph Dale Alvey.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF607, 22TR2872, 22TR2873, 22TR2874, 22TR2970, 22TR2971, & 22TR2972, Court reviews file and enters NG's on the TR files those are to trail CF file.  Court proceeds to ARGN on 22CF607- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG. Atty Larimore states he just received discovery today. Motions to be filed within 20 days. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:24 PM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:54 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Joseph Dale Alvey in court.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Joseph Dale Alvey.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF607(PH), 22TR2872, 22TR2873, 22TR2874, 22TR2970, 22TR2971, & 22002972- TR matters set for PTC.  Atty Larimore states they plan to waive prelim. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:06 PM. bph
Arraignment scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Arraignment on October 12, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

DE called and stated that he needs to request a refusal hearing and has been unable to get ahold of his Atty, so he went to Atty Nero's office for advice, were DE was advised to request a refusal hearing. DE was looking for a form to fill out.  Clerk advise DE that he could write his request on a piece of paper and fax, mail or bring it in person to the COC office.  Includes 22TR2874, 22TR2873, 22TR2872 and 22CF607. sm
22R 012531   Posted by self.  gll

$200 on file- $550 remaining bond to be posted no later than 9/12/22 at noon.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least THREE times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:17 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Holly Rockow appeared.  Stephanie Schmidt with Intern Lanie Krause appeared for Defendant for today. Defendant Joseph Dale Alvey in court, in custody. Includes 22CF607, 22TR2872, 22TR2873, 22TR2874. Court questions DE regarding posting bond. DE states he can post the money, but it's at his house. DE states he will find reliable transportation. Court will allow DE to post remaining cash by 9/12/22 at noon. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets Prelim. Adjourned at 1:21 PM.  gll
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
